alert.note: Alert for Broward; Collier; Glades; Hendry; Mainland Monroe; Miami-Dade; Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued September 23 at 5:04PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE NEXT WEEK ACROSS SOUTH FLORIDA FROM DEPRESSION NUMBER 9... Tropical Depression Number 9 in the Central Caribbean Sea is forecast by the National Hurricane Center to move west northwest this weekend before moving more northward towards South Florida next week. Tropical Depression Number 9 will bring in deep tropical moisture to South Florida for most of next week. There remains some uncertainty regarding the exact timing and track of this system, but the potential exists for significant rainfall across the area for most of next week. The grounds are still somewhat saturated from recent heavy rainfall and any additional heavy rainfall could lead to flooding across South Florida, especially over urban and poor drainage areas. A Flood Watch may be needed for portions of South Florida sometime late this weekend or early next week. Interests across all of South Florida are strongly encouraged to monitor the latest information from the National Weather Service in Miami, Florida.
